titleStmt.title: A learned and very eloquent treatie [sic], writen in Latin by the famouse man Heironymus Osorius Bishop of Sylua in Portugal, wherein he confuteth a certayne aunswere made by M. Walter Haddon against the Epistle of the said bishoppe vnto the Queenes Maiestie. Translated into English by Iohn Fen student of Diuinitie in the Vniuersitie of Louen
In Gualtherum Haddonum de vera religione libri tres. English
titleStmt.author: Osório, Jerónimo, 1506-1580.

titleStmt.title: A learned and very eloquent treatie [sic], writen in Latin by the famouse man Heironymus Osorius Bishop of Sylua in Portugal, wherein he confuteth a certayne aunswere made by M. Walter Haddon against the Epistle of the said bishoppe vnto the Queenes Maiestie. Translated into English by Iohn Fen student of Diuinitie in the Vniuersitie of Louen
In Gualtherum Haddonum de vera religione libri tres. English
titleStmt.author: Osório, Jerónimo, 1506-1580.
Fenn, John, 1535-1614.

notesStmt.note: A translation of: In Gualtherum Haddonum de vera religione libri tres.
"Written in answer to Haddon's Pro reformatione Anglicane."--Folger Library Catalogue.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
